title: The Behavior of Co0.52Mn0.48O/SiO2 Under H2 Using In Situ Closed-Cell Gas-Reaction STEM
content: To be used as transportation fuels, CO2 can be converted into long-chain hydrocarbons via the CO2 hydrogenation pathway [1]. Co catalysts modified with Mn oxides are catalyst candidates of interest since they exhibit high C-C coupling activity in similar CO hydrogenation reactions [2]. In general, CoO reduction under H2 occurs at ∼400°C. However, the addition of Mn can shift the CoO reduction to higher temperatures allowing for controlled Co speciation with Mn concentration and reduction temperature. Therefore, an investigation of the Co species in Co-Mn oxide system is appealing.
